programme.title: Maid-Sama!
programme.desc: Misaki's secret is spreading; now the Three Idiots are onto her too! Worse, the school festival's coming, and Class 2-2's about to rebel! One single mistake could expose her!

programme.title: Inception
programme.desc: A thief (Leonardo DiCaprio) who enters peoples dreams and steals their secrets gets a shot at redemption when he is given the dangerous task of planting an idea in someones subconscious. Starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Elliot Page.

programme.title: Spartacus: House of Ashur
programme.desc: Achillia returns to the arena to face her greatest challenge, while Ashur wrestles with the emotional fallout of his actions.

programme.title: The BMF Documentary: Blowing Money Fast
programme.desc: In Atlanta, Meech wants to expand by launching BMF Entertainment and stepping into the music industry; a deadly shooting at Atlantas hottest nightclub puts BMF in the spotlight, bringing unwanted attention and causing a rift between the brothers.

programme.title: Poetic Justice
programme.desc: A beauty-salon worker (Janet Jackson) goes from South Central Los Angeles to Oakland in a mail truck with a guy (Tupac Shakur) she cannot stand. Starring Janet Jackson, Tupac Shakur, Regina King.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: A medical-school dropout tries to hide his attraction to his new friend, a bubbly artist who already has a boyfriend. Starring Daniel Radcliffe, Zoe Kazan, Megan Park.

programme.title: The Break-Up
programme.desc: Former lovers (Vince Vaughn, Jennifer Aniston) live together as hostile roommates when both refuse to move out of their shared condominium. Starring Vince Vaughn, Jennifer Aniston, Joey Lauren Adams.

programme.title: Its Complicated
programme.desc: A restaurateur (Meryl Streep) falls into an affair with her remarried ex-husband (Alec Baldwin), while an architect (Steve Martin) that she hired to refurbish her kitchen falls in love with her. Starring Meryl Streep, Steve Martin, Alec Baldwin.

programme.title: Blizzard
programme.desc: A youngster learns about true friendship with the help of a magically gifted reindeer from the North Pole. Starring Brenda Blethyn, Christopher Plummer, Kevin Pollak.

programme.title: Whale
programme.desc: A young boy is sent to live with his grandparents in a remote indigenous community. Starring Timmy Masso, Grace George, Joe Martin.

programme.title: Island of Lemurs: Madagascar
programme.desc: Millions of years ago, lemurs arrived as castaways on the island of Madagascar. Today, Dr. Patricia C. Wright is on a mission to ensure that these strange and endangered creatures survive in the modern world.

programme.title: Escape From Planet Earth
programme.desc: A heroic astronaut (Brendan Fraser) dashes off on an ill-advised rescue mission. After he becomes caught in a fiendish trap, he must rely on his nerdy brother (Rob Corddry) to save him. Starring Rob Corddry, Brendan Fraser, Sarah Jessica Parker.

programme.title: Monsters vs. Aliens
programme.desc: A giant woman (Reese Witherspoon), a bug-headed scientist (Hugh Laurie) and a gelatinous mass (Seth Rogen) are among the ragtag monsters that must defend Earth from a rampaging alien robot. Starring Reese Witherspoon, Hugh Laurie, Seth Rogen.

programme.title: Astro Boy
programme.desc: Learning that his friends and family are in danger, a robotic child (Freddie Highmore) marshals his incredible powers and returns home to Metro City. Starring Freddie Highmore, Kristen Bell, Nathan Lane.

programme.title: Pacific Rim
programme.desc: As a war between humankind and monstrous sea creatures wages on, a former pilot and a trainee are paired up to drive a seemingly obsolete special weapon in an effort to save the world. Starring Charlie Hunnam, Diego Klattenhoff, Idris Elba.

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth. Starring Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino.

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Two interstellar agents try to stop an alien disguised as a lingerie model from destroying the world. Starring Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn.

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history. Starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Josh Brolin.

programme.title: The Strangers: Chapter 2
programme.desc: After learning that their victim, Maya, is still alive, three masked maniacs return to finish the job. With nowhere to run and no one to trust, Maya finds herself in a fight for survival against psychopaths wholl kill anyone who stands in their way. Starring Madelaine Petsch, Gabriel Basso, Froy Gutierrez.

programme.title: Imaginary
programme.desc: When Jessica moves back into her childhood home, her youngest stepdaughter, Alice, finds a stuffed bear named Chauncey; Alices behavior becomes more and more concerning, Jessica soon realizes that Chauncey is much more than a toy. Starring DeWanda Wise, Tom Payne, Taegen Burns.

programme.title: Our House
programme.desc: A science wiz creates a machine that can bring back dead loved ones, which seems like a great idea -- until the wrong spirits are unleashed. Starring John Ralston, Thomas Mann, Percy Hynes White.

programme.title: Get Out
programme.desc: A young photographer uncovers a dark secret when he meets his girlfriends seemingly friendly parents for the first time at their posh estate. Starring Daniel Kaluuya, Allison Williams, Catherine Keener.

programme.title: Us
programme.desc: A couple and their two children must fight for survival when four masked strangers descend upon their beachfront home. When the masks come off, the family is horrified to learn that each attacker takes the appearance of one of them. Starring Lupita Nyongo, Winston Duke, Elisabeth Moss.

programme.title: Sesame Street Presents: Follow That Bird
programme.desc: Big Bird, whisked away to Illinois by a misguided social worker, sets out to rejoin his friends in New York. Starring Paul Bartel, Sandra Bernhard, John Candy.

programme.title: Tom and Jerrys Giant Adventure
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry encounter a grumpy giant after climbing a beanstalk to a magical land. Starring Garrison Keillor, Paul Reubens, Grey DeLisle.

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon
programme.desc: A misfit Viking teenager sees a chance to change the course of his clans future when he befriends an injured dragon. Starring Jay Baruchel, Gerard Butler, America Ferrera.

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon 2
programme.desc: When Hiccup and Toothless discover a cave thats home to hundreds of wild dragons and the mysterious Dragon Rider, the two friends find themselves at the center of a battle to protect the peace. Starring Jay Baruchel, Cate Blanchett, Gerard Butler.

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World

programme.desc: Dr. Magnus and the Sanctuary team attempt to capture a rare and deadly creature while under the watchful eye of a local news crew.

programme.title: The Reader (2008)
programme.desc: In postwar Germany, a teenager (David Kross) has a love affair with an older woman (Kate Winslet) who is hiding a terrible secret.

programme.title: Ask the Dust (2006)
programme.desc: In Depression-era Los Angeles, a fiery Mexican waitress (Salma Hayek) who wants to improve her lot through marriage meets an aspiring writer (Colin Farrell) of Italian descent.

programme.title: The Argument (2020)
programme.desc: When a couple argue about a party and neither will back down, they decide to re-create the evening to determine who is right.

programme.title: Bridget Joness Diary (2001)
programme.desc: An outrageous British woman (Renee Zellweger) decides to take control of her life, but instead falls for two very different men (Colin Firth, Hugh Grant).

programme.title: Roman Holiday (1953)
programme.desc: A young princess (Audrey Hepburn), tired of her constraints, runs off with a U.S. newsman (Gregory Peck) in Rome.

programme.title: Runaway Bride (1999)
programme.desc: A New York reporter (Richard Gere) travels to Maryland to profile a woman (Julia Roberts) who left three bridegrooms at the altar.

programme.title: Down to You (2000)
programme.desc: Two collegians (Freddie Prinze Jr., Julia Stiles) fall in love but have a bumpy affair due to mischievous roommates and the temptation to stray.

programme.title: Save the Last Dance (2001)
programme.desc: A white teenager (Julia Stiles) moves to Chicago after her mothers death and falls for a black student (Sean Patrick Thomas) who shares her love of dance.

programme.title: Kate and Leopold (2001)
programme.desc: A Manhattan woman (Meg Ryan) falls in love with the 19th-century Duke of Albany (Hugh Jackman) who has stepped through a time portal.

programme.title: Election (1999)
programme.desc: Tracy faces no competition in her high school election, but the civics teacher intervenes by encouraging the varsity football player to run for president, resulting in chaos.

programme.title: The Stepford Wives (2004)
programme.desc: A man and his wife move to a quaint suburb where most of the women seem to have the same bland personality.

programme.title: The Virgin Suicides (1999)
programme.desc: Men reminisce about intriguing sisters, whose parents (James Woods, Kathleen Turner) quarantined them after one of the five killed herself.

programme.title: Frida (2002)
programme.desc: Mexican painter Frida Kahlo (Salma Hayek) marries fellow artist Diego Rivera who shares her radical political views.

programme.title: Like Water for Chocolate (1992)
programme.desc: The youngest daughter (Lumi Cavazos) of a Mexican family expresses her feelings in preparing wonderful food, when tradition keeps her from marrying her true love (Marco Leonardi).

programme.title: Cold Mountain (2003)
programme.desc: During the Civil War, a wounded Confederate soldier (Jude Law) abandons his duties to make his way home to his sweetheart (Nicole Kidman).

programme.title: Jersey Girl (2004)
programme.desc: A young woman (Liv Tyler) changes the life of a single father (Ben Affleck) who used to be a successful New York music publicist.

programme.title: Losing Isaiah (1995)
programme.desc: An ex-crack addict (Halle Berry) fights for custody of her son adopted by a social worker (Jessica Lange) and her husband (David Strathairn).

programme.title: End of Sentence (2019)
programme.desc: After being released from prison, a young man reluctantly embarks on a journey with his estranged father to spread his mothers ashes in her native Ireland.

programme.title: Blue Eyed Girl (2025)
programme.desc: Summoned home to visit her two sisters and her ailing father, a woman starts to re-evaluate her life as she wonders what could have been.

programme.title: The Edge of Seventeen (2016)
programme.desc: A high school junior (Hailee Steinfeld) develops an unexpected bond with a thoughtful teen (Hayden Szeto) after learning that her best friend (Haley Lu Richardson) is dating her older brother (Blake Jenner).

programme.title: Pixie (2020)
programme.desc: Pixie sets out to avenge her mothers death and attempts a heist that will give her the means to leave her small-town life behind. When the plan goes horribly wrong, shes forced to team up with a pair of misfits who are clearly in over their heads.

programme.title: Shes All That (1999)
programme.desc: A cool teen (Freddie Prinze Jr.) bets a friend that he can transform the schools geekiest girl (Rachael Leigh Cook) into a prom queen.

programme.title: Win a Date With Tad Hamilton! (2004)
programme.sub-title: Win a Date With Tad Hamilton! (2004)
